title: My cursor wont work in game
body:
My mouse works just fine in the launcher, but the second I get in game it can't click anything.
It can hover around the screen, but can't left/right click anything, so I can't move, buy or attack.
I tried to change the binds to keyboard keys, but that doesn't seem to work either.
Does anyone else experience this issue? I couldn't find any solution online.

replies.body:
I'm seeing this happen a lot lately, and *usually* the culprit is the Discord Overlay. Be sure to turn that off, as well as any other programs that might have overlays (you could do a clean boot to make sure nothing else is running). 

If this doesn't work, you could go ahead and try a config reset as well. I've seen a few players mention this alternative works as well, so worth a shot!

- Log into the game client
- Navigate to C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\
- Delete the folder named **Config**
- Go into a practice game and verify that settings have saved properly. 
- Leave game to sync settings

Depending on if you have a Mac you might need to buy a apple Magic Mouse.  I had this problem a while ago.  The Mac OS Sierra has problems with some mouses, so if you have a Mac try using the apple mouse.

I had a similar problem, what you should do is delete your preferences folder and restart league, go into settings and change some stuff around if you had any custom key binds for example (as it deletes your personal settings too) but when you start a game it should work just fine.
